com.informatics.lehigh.cardboardarlibrary

Class GarUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.informatics.lehigh.cardboardarlibrary.GarUtil

  • public class GarUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for various OpenGL and GAR operations. You must instantiate and object if you wish to use methods that access resources, otherwise all other functions are static.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GarUtil(android.content.res.Resources res)
      Utility object for various OpenGL ES common tasks.

      Calculates a column-major rotation matrix from the given OpenCV rvec.

    • Method Detail

      • loadGLShader

        public int loadGLShader(int type,
                        int resId)
        Converts a raw text file, saved as a resource, into an OpenGL ES shader.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of shader we will be creating.
        resId - The resource ID of the raw text file about to be turned into a shader.
        Returns:
        The shader object handler.

      • checkGLError

        public void checkGLError(java.lang.String label)
        Checks if we've had an error inside of OpenGL ES, and if so what that error is.
        Parameters:
        label - Label to report in case of error.

      • getCardboardToWorldTransform

        public static void getCardboardToWorldTransform(float[] M,
                                                com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
        Calculates a column-major transformation matrix that will transform a vector in the basis formed by the Google cardboard (up, right, and forward vector from the HeadTransform) to the world system (right-handed for OpenGL). I.e., given the returned matrix M, and a vector b in cardboard coordinates, then a = M * b where a is in world coordinates.
        Parameters:
        M - The 4x4 matrix to place the transformation in.
        headTransform - The head transform to form the transformation from

      • getTranslationMatFromTvec

        public static void getTranslationMatFromTvec(float[] transMat,
                                             org.opencv.core.Mat tvec,
                                             com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
        Calculates a column-major translation matrix from the given OpenCV tvec. This method transforms the translation into the world coordinate system to valid OpenGL coordinates using the given HeadTransform, which could be passed directly into a shader to translate an object to the marker that produced the tvec.
        Parameters:
        transMat - The 4x4 matrix to place the translation in.
        tvec - OpenCV tvec.

      • tvecToCardboardCoords

        public static void tvecToCardboardCoords(float[] cardTvec,
                                         org.opencv.core.Mat tvec)
        Changes a tvec produced from OpenCV to be in a right handed OpenGL-compatible coordinate system with the same origin as OpenCV (so the cardboard coordinate system). This simply negates the y and z of the OpenCV tvec.
        Parameters:
        cardTvec - The 4 element array to place the new translation vector in. glTvec[3] is just 1.0
        tvec - The OpenCV tvec to use.

      • getRotationMatFromRvec

        public static void getRotationMatFromRvec(float[] rotMat,
                                          org.opencv.core.Mat rvec,
                                          com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
        Calculates a column-major rotation matrix from the given OpenCV rvec. This method transforms the rotation into the world coordinate system using the given HeadTransform to valid OpenGL coordinates, which could be passed directly into a shader to rotate an object to the the pose estimated by the marker that produced the rvec.
        Parameters:
        rotMat - The 4x4 matrix to place the rotation in.
        rvec - OpenCV rvec.
        headTransform - The HeadTransform for the current frame.

      • getTransformationFromTrackingParams

        public static void getTransformationFromTrackingParams(float[] transMat,
                                                       org.opencv.core.Mat tvec,
                                                       org.opencv.core.Mat rvec,
                                                       com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
        Takes in an OpenCV tvec and rvec, and returns a transformation matrix to place an object defined in the Cardboard coordinate system (defined by up, right, and forward vectors from the HeadTransform) in the pose and location defined by the tvec and rvec.



        Note: this method is recommended for drawing augmented objects in the scene.
        Parameters:
        transMat - The 4x4 matrix to place the transformation in.
        tvec - The OpenCV tvec to use.
        rvec - The OpenCV rvec to use.
        headTransform - The head transformation from the same frame as tvec and rvec.
